title: Celebrity appoints first female captain
text:
Celebrity appoints first female captain 13 July 2015 Save 
Celebrity Cruises has appointed its first female captain who will take the helm of Celebrity Summit in August. 
Kate McCue, 37, will be in charge of the 91,000 ton, 965-foot ship and its safe navigation as well as the 2,158 guests and 952 crew members. 
She has been promoted to the position having worked in the maritime industry for 15 years and has experience in navigating a number of far-flung seas and oceans, including the Pacific and the Caribbean, as well as the Panama Canal. 
McCue said: “Becoming the first female American captain of a cruise ship has been a goal of mine for as long as I can remember. 
“The honor is amplified by being the first at a company like Celebrity Cruises.” 
Lisa Lutoff-Perlo, president and chief executive of Celebrity Cruises, added: “Of all the great moments throughout my career, this is at the top of my list. 
“I am both honored that Kate accepted this position, and proud of the way our team continues to transform the way people think about Celebrity, and about cruising in general.”
